DataElement.preferredName: Patient Childhood B Lymphoblastic Lymphoma Childhood Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia Blast Count Confirmatory Test Eligibility Determination Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response indicating the patient meets the eligibility requirements for participation in a clinical trial with regards to blast count confirmatory testing for individuals diagnosed with Childhood B Lymphoblastic Lymphoma or Childhood Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Childhood B Lymphoblastic Lymphoma Childhood Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia Blast Count Confirmatory Test Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:A B-lymphoblastic lymphoma that occurs during childhood._An acute lymphoblastic leukemia occurring during childhood.  The majority of cases are B-acute lymphoblastic leukemias. Approximately 15% of the cases are T-acute lymphoblastic leukemias._The determination of the number of blast cells present in a biospecimen._A test whose operational purpose is to verify the presence or absence of a substance, organism, or condition._The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Childhood B Lymphoblastic Lymphoma Childhood Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia Blast Count Confirmatory Test Eligibility Determination
Property.preferredDefinition: A B-lymphoblastic lymphoma that occurs during childhood._An acute lymphoblastic leukemia occurring during childhood.  The majority of cases are B-acute lymphoblastic leukemias. Approximately 15% of the cases are T-acute lymphoblastic leukemias._The determination of the number of blast cells present in a biospecimen._A test whose operational purpose is to verify the presence or absence of a substance, organism, or condition._The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

Concepts.definition: A B-lymphoblastic lymphoma that occurs during childhood.
An acute lymphoblastic leukemia occurring during childhood.  The majority of cases are B-acute lymphoblastic leukemias. Approximately 15% of the cases are T-acute lymphoblastic leukemias.
The determination of the number of blast cells present in a biospecimen.
A test whose operational purpose is to verify the presence or absence of a substance, organism, or condition.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ReferenceDocuments.name: PQT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient meet the eligibility requirements for participation in a clinical trial with regards to blast count confirmatory testing for individuals diagnosed with Childhood B Lymphoblastic Lymphoma or Childhood Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If B-ALL or B-LL patient with M2 morphology, was local confirmatory testing  done showing equal to or greater than 5% blasts by flow cytometry, FISH testing or other molecular method?
